sect1.title: Starchart operations
sect1.para: The Echo Cluster is a square of 2000 by 2000 light-years, the starchart provides the player an extra view, a margin around the Echo Cluster of 500 LY wide. It has a grid, with 100 LY between lines.
To scroll the starchart you can use the arrow keys, or drag it with the mouse. Also, you can toggle the grid by pressing Ctrl G and zoom in and zoom out with + and - from the keypad.

The planet names are automatically hidden when you zoom out below 100%, but if you want you can turn them off using the Planet names entry on the View menu. Similar actions you can make with minefields and ion storms.

On the View menu, you also have the Scanner area option, when activated will paint a shaded area on the starchart showing the sensors range that is covered from your ship and planets. You can use this feature with the CtrlA keystroke too. This feature is disabled by default.
